Job Title: DOTM SECURITY SUPERVISOR

Location: Fort Smith, AR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Position Number: 22089424

County: Sebastian

Posting End Date: April 28, 2024 

Anticipated Starting Salary: $36,155.00 

Fort Chaffee

The mission of the Department of Military is to provide a professional staff of Arkansas State Employees who help maintain and improve the readiness of Arkansas National Guard units through effective fiscal management of State Resources, Human Resource Management, and quality administration of Arkansas National Guard Programs.

 The Department of the Military is a Drug-Free Workplace, this includes medical marijuana which is still considered a controlled substance under federal law. (Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988) 

Position Information

Class Code: X330C

Grade:GS06

FLSA Status: NON-EXEMPT

Salary Range: $36,155 - $52,424

Summary

The Security Officer Supervisor is responsible for the security operation of an agency. This position is governed by state and federal laws and agency/institution policy. Must be 21 to carry a weapon and have the ability to pass a physical agility test.

Functions

Supervises a small to medium-sized staff of security personnel, including interviewing applicants and recommending for hiring, approving leave, conducting background checks, training employees, making work assignments, and evaluating the performance of incumbents. Supervises and performs foot and/or motorized patrol of buildings, grounds, and parking areas, and may issue parking tickets. Takes corrective actions for minor violations and coordinates with local law enforcement personnel for the more serious violations. Maintains fire and security alarm systems by monitoring the alarm panels, arming, and disarming the systems, inspecting, and conducting required tests to ensure proper operations. Directs and conducts inspections of buildings and grounds for fire and safety hazards, security, and unauthorized personnel, and takes corrective actions as needed. Maintains security communication system, controls access codes and key logs, and issues keys as directed. Supervises the operation of agencies’ switchboards during holidays and non-working hours to ensure that calls are properly answered, directed, and logged. Conducts research and develops and maintains standard operating procedures for a security section. Compiles and maintains required reports and files. Performs other duties as assigned.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Dimensions

N/A

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Knowledge of supervisory practices and procedures. Knowledge of public safety policies, procedures, and regulations. Knowledge of public safety methods and techniques. Ability to plan, organize, and oversee the work of subordinates. Ability to perform security duties and direct the activities of a security section. Ability to conduct and direct fire and safety inspections. Ability to communicate orally and in writing. Ability to pass a (PAT) Physical Agility Test.

Minimum Qualifications

The formal education equivalent of a high school diploma; plus, three years of experience in security, law enforcement, fire safety, or a related field, including one year in a leadership capacity. Additional requirements determined by the agency for recruiting purposes require review and approval by the Office of Personnel Management. Must be 21 years of age to carry a weapon on the military installation.

OTHER JOB-RELATED EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE MAY BE SUBSTITUTED FOR ALL OR PART OF THESE BASIC REQUIREMENTS, EXCEPT FOR CERTIFICATION OR LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS, UPON APPROVAL OF THE QUALIFICATIONS REVIEW COMMITTEE.

Licenses

Additional requirements determined by the agency for recruiting purposes require review and approval by the Office of Personnel Management.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
